name: St. Stanislaus Kostka
summary: Stanislaus Kostka was a Polish Jesuit novice who died at the age of 18. Despite opposition from his noble family, he traveled on foot from Poland to Rome to join the Jesuits. He is known for his deep piety, devotion to the Eucharist, and visions of the Blessed Virgin Mary. He is the patron saint of Poland, students, and novices, and is particularly venerated by young people.
